newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Three Israeli soldiers wounded by Lebanon mine.
newsitem.headline: Three Israeli soldiers wounded by Lebanon mine.

text.p: Three Israeli soldiers were wounded by a mine explosion on Wednesday in the south Lebanon border zone occupied by the Jewish state, security sources said.
One soldier was in fair condition and the other two were lightly wounded after the blast in the eastern sector in the south Lebanon zone, the sources said.
On Tuesday, Moslem guerrillas attacked Israeli and allied militia posts and some shells slammed into two villages in the zone, pro-Israeli militia sources said.
The Iranian-backed Hizbollah -- Party of God -- claimed responsibility for Tuesday's attacks. It said its gunners targetted two military barracks in Aishiyeh and Rihane villages.

Hizbollah is leading a guerrilla war against Israeli troops and the 3,000-strong South Lebanon Army militia holding the 15-km (nine-miles) south Lebanon zone set up in 1985 to protect northern Israel from cross-frontier raids.
